Steinitz pounces on the Rook, but he leaves his King defenseless and his position undeveloped.
Forcing the Bishop to move away from the King file.
Delaying Bird one move.
A very safe haven. Steinitz's King, by contrast, is in grave danger.
A useless move. Steinitz should have at least taken the chance to Castle. It probably wouldn't have helped much but he could drag out his resistance some.
Forcing the action. If Steinitz tries 14... BPxP, Bird has 15 QxKP ch K-B1 16 PxP ch KxP 17 B-R6 mate!
14... O-O may have been marginally better, but the position is hopeless in any case.
Bird misses the spectacular finishing line 15 PxQP dbl ch K-B1 16 Q-K8 ch QxQ 17 PxQ (Q) mate! However, he hunts down Steinitz's King quickly enough.
Forced, else 16 QxR is decisive.
Opening the King file to deadly effect.
16... KxP is equally bad [17 PxP dis ch.]
Aiming down the mighty open file.
Delays mate by one move.
The final blow.
Forced.
Finis. Bird tied Steinitz's position into knots.
